title: PROJECT: Udyr
body:
I don't know why I never though of this before, but the thematic of the champion fit so well with the project theme. A warrior who uses the spirits of the animals to a monk like lifestyle, makes so much sense to be studied and reconstructed in the future as a project. I don't know exactly the lore of project, but that's what makes it cooler. I don't know if they are the actual champions rebuilt from augmentation, a suit for a normal human to become augmented, or a fully reconstructed robot.

But Udyr fits so damn well for a project skin. They could put good effort into it and make it 1350, maybe 1820 if it was the highlight. He could have lights all over his body, at the start of the game they are off, whenever he enters a stance the lights change colouse and his suit could slightly change formation. Blue for bear, green for turtle, red for phoenix, yellow for tiger.

Like it literally fits so well with him I don't know why it isn't considered. If it was 1820 I can already think of some interactions and lines. Maybe he could start going on about the spirit of the animals and then become conflicted with the fact that he is a robot now. Or maybe his suit could be powered by Udyr's animal connection.

As for the model I think he should look fairly beefy. Not thin like Fiora, more of a tanky spiky sort of feel. His Tiger Stance could maybe have a little light with a PROJECT Tiger on the back and light up yellow on all his colour windows, whilst making claws come out of his hands kind of like a robotic Wolverine. His W could summon a Project shield, light up a turtle on the back and make green appear on the colour windows, maybe some kind of skirt like armor could come down further, to mimic his normal skins. His E could beef up his arms and lock his fists into a shape, light up a project bear on his back and make his lights go blue. His R could light up a phoenix on his back, make his lights go red, and his suit could open and extend wing like things around his arms and could either emit red glowing energy or fire, energy sounds cooler.

As for the sounds, I can already hear them in my head. You know the sound of a spring getting magnetized or a spring in like a storm catcher, kind of tinish sound? That could play whenever he switches stances, in his Q when he does his fast slash, it could play a kind of sound like PROJECT: Ashe's Q sound. His W could make some really generic shield activation sound, I'm sure they would come up with something, his E could play a sort of project Ekko E/Q sound when he stunned someone, and his ult could make a sweeping sound similar to Camille's W or something, and he could push his hands forward.

On top of that everytime he entered a stance, a pixelated animal sound could play, like it was through a loudspeaker or something. This whole skin just seems like it fits Udyr, all the effects would be straight forward in the design process, I know Riot does Project skin every year now, even though I am posting this in OCE I hope that they consider Udyr for a candidate as even though he isn't really meta he does need a new skin by now, he hasn't had one in ages.

replies.body: Love the detail you put into this post. I can imagine it

I only hope they make this skin , I think it's a vrey grate idea and when was the last time they made a udyr skin  was 1 of April in 2015 that's almost 2 years ago , I just hope they make an udyr skin ,doesn't have to be this one , I just hope they make one in general {{champion:77}} {{item:3070}} {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Can I also add you as a friend

I think the only reason to why this is held back is because thematically it probably doesn't work too well on Udyr, this is especially the case when we consider the central theme of the PROJECT skin line is generally emphasising on the loss of individual will and identity and the cyborgs' attempts of trying to retain/regain them.

When we apply onto Udyr who's entire idea is about him fighting against well, other parts of himself; throwing him into the PROJECT skin line would completely invalidate his central identity than expanding or making a fun twist out of it imo. Because when he is the cyborg he's fighting against the LOSS of himself and not the EXISTING ASPECTS of himself (his central idea) which would imo mean it rather than taking an interesting approach on Udyr, it's kinda going against it.

UNLESS the PROJECT skin is gonna happen after SPU, when he'd mastered all aspects of himself. But wow, what's that gonna be, the ultimate-ultimate skin (it may very well be, because this guy always needs 4 skins per package)? Gee even just imagining it makes me wet.

But idk. The idea seems neat though.

Well based on your second part this is even better. Obviously it's based after SGU, in the future. It's sort of as if he loses all of himself except for his strength and somehow the Project manages to manifest his strength into power, not requiring the spirits or whatever. Idk. Most Project champions are Ionian, though we have seen that is not the only place that projects can arise. I just could picture Udyr in a Project trailer/teaser. Thematically it fits, I don't know much about the lore.

It's just a cool idea having like a robot with animal powers lol
i doubt they would as it probably would be on par if not better than spirit guard at a fraction of the cost.

Well it fits the theme and Riot would definitely do this if it did make them money, most people who want SGU would have it by now, and they would be looking to get more money out of Udyr since his basic skin is so outdated. The two other skins are garbage, his Definitely not Udyr skin is a troll, so SGU is the only serious one people would buy and it's $30, so by expanding down to 1350 or 1820 Riot would probably be able to sell a lot and I think from a business perspective this could work, maybe not as wide spread as meta champion skins but it isn't really that hard to make and could lead to extended profit like SGU.

They could even do the Project loading screen sorta thing but make it four colours or something, and icons just like last year. Wouldn't be hard to make people buy it if they did the whole Project Cache sorta thing.
